Reviews.Title: “Been here several times...always a good stay!”
Reviews.Author: CHazen
Reviews.Content: I was here with a group tour September 11/12. This is my third time staying at this property with a group tour! Property is always very clean and well kept. Rooms are comfortable..and again, very clean. In addition, price is right especially when compared to other Branson properties! If you want to stay on the strip, this is not the place for you. But if you want a nice, clean, comfortable, well-priced place to spend your nights...I suggest you look into Branson Towers! I enjoyed working with the group tours staff as they were always very cheerful and helpful! As an added bonus, they have a nice feature serving cobbler and ice cream beginning at 10:00 p.m. When you come back from a show it is a nice option to be able to have a little before bed snack!! Plus the piano player they have there makes for a very nice atmosphere and a nice way to end the day!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: luggagecheck
Reviews.Content: I booked this through a third party site and didn't know the name of the hotel until after I'd paid for it. I must admit that some of the reviews had me worried but I was very relieved to find out that my worries were for nothing. This was a very nice hotel. Our room had two queen beds. Even though it was not one of the premium (newly renovated) rooms, it was spacious, clean, comfortable and met our family's needs. The beds were very nice and we made full use of the refrigerator and microwave in the room. The free breakfast buffet was very good with offerings of waffles, eggs, sausage, donuts, bagels, biscuits & gravy. The nightly ice cream social and live entertainment was a nice treat that definitely makes this hotel memorable. We had one issue with our shower not working properly. But once I called the front desk, there was someone at my door within 15 minutes and the problem was fixed promptly. This was a great hotel with a friendly staff. I could certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: txlady1975
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time staying at Branson Towers. What a wonderful place to call home when we're away from home. Outstanding Service, lovely clean rooms, amazing breakfast and overall a feeling like we never left home. We would definitely recommend Branson Towers to any. It's also very convenient to any of the attractions/shows but still easy to access and it's very quiet. They go out of the way to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Each night after each show they do a Ice Cream Social - It's delicious!!

Reviews.Title: “My tour group loves Branson Towers”
Reviews.Author: easydriver251
Reviews.Content: My motor-coach group just got back from Branson on August 16, this is the 2nd year we have used the Branson Towers. The rooms are spacious and clean, and the staff is great. They took care of all of my groups needs. We will be back!! P J tours Pat

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: yellowcat3
Reviews.Content: We were flying out the next day and ended up here due to a car show in Branson. I had a 3 star rating and I felt comfortable with that. This is an older property that could use some TLC, The beds were comfortable, linens looked well worn. Plenty of towels. It was clean, but needs general maintenance. Curtains were coming off the hooks, trash can coming into hotel was rusted and over flowing with cigarettes. Looks like the hallways need doors painted and general rug cleaning. The breakfast was o.k., items were running low because it was 15 minutes before they closed. On a brighter note they had a ice cream social in the evening. We went down to see what it was about and had the pleasure of listening to the Voices of Glory from Americas Got Talent. What a nice surprise. Probably a excellent choice for a family on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst I've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: BigEFortSmith
Reviews.Content: This hotel was alright I guess if your on a budget. The beds were really comfortable and the air conditioning worked really well so for $60 you can't expect much more. The smell of the room was horrible though! Smelled like someone chain smoked in it for years. Just looking for a little weekend getaway so we weren't expecting anything spectacular. Probably wouldn't stay here again due to the smell.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Patricia R
Reviews.Content: after attending the Missouri State Fair we decided to take a drive down to Branson on a whim. We came upon Branson Towers. We booked a King Jacuzzi Suite for two nights. Because we were checking in late around 1am, they gave us a discounted rate, which I thought was great. As soon as we got on the elevator it was hot and had a foul oder. We get to our room and immediately i was disappointed. The jacuzzi tub was dirty. There was red stains in the tub, nail polish it looked like, my boyfriend ran the water to check it out and you can see dirt floating. I went to expect the bathroom and the shower curtain was filthy. We were both super tired and decided we would get some rest and leave first thing in the morning, which was 7am to be exact. I expressed my disappointment of the room to the front desk clerk, Tosha, and she seemed unconcern, as if she knew this routine already. She didn't apologize or even tried to offer any other room or anything. We got our refund for the second night and left. We took our services to Radisson and wished we would have went there first!

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience here.”
Reviews.Author: bransonlvr
Reviews.Content: I called several hours ahead to confirm my reservations, and told them I wouldn't be arriving until late (around 1am). They assured me that our room was ready and waiting on us. The temperature in Branson had been over 110 F that day and they didn't even have the air on. So it was sweltering when we arrived. I called to complain and the desk clerk said that he could move us to a handicap assesible room but that the air want on in there either! I explained that I wasn't handicapped, I was hot. At 5am we were still lying across the beds with no cover, burning up. Turns out the air unit was not working properly and wasn't blowing compressed air. They replaced the unit next day but we lost a full nights sleep due to heat for which we were not reimbursed or offered anything! The hotel was dirty. Dirty carpeting in rooms and hall. Dirty chairs in hall alcove. This hotel was advertized as 3 stars by the company we booked through. NOT!!! BEWARE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Branson Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Donna R
Reviews.Content: We Had a wonderful time in Branson. We stayed at Branson Towers. We Brought my mother for her 80 th birthday everyone at the hotel were so nice they were very friendly and asked if we needed anything special they went out of their way to make sure our stay was excellent. The rooms were very clean and the beds were very comfortable. The breakfast was excellent and they had a large selection of items to choose from. I will stay there next time I come to Branson. Thank you so much everyone at Branson Towers !!!! Donna and Henry Ross

Reviews.Title: “Branson Towers is now our hotel to go to, without question.”
Reviews.Author: Janice R
Reviews.Content: This was our stay at Branson Towers. We have stayed at several other nice motels in Branson and was surpised the Branson Towers had reasonable rates. We had a handicapped room on first flower, near the vending machines, parking lot and restaurant. The breakfast was deliciious in a beautiful large dining room setting. Another plus was the coffee machine near the parking lot door. We would get a cup on the way to our room....anytime of day. The room was large and very clean. As we walked into the hotel you could smell a clean smell. I have already been referring people to the Branson Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: Freddie W
Reviews.Content: it is not a 5 star hotel but it don't cost like a 5 star hotel, the hotel is nice for the price. the rooms are clean and the beds are o k. it is in a good localation. the breakfast is good, better than most.

Reviews.Title: “This place is truly awful.”
Reviews.Author: brightestblue
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I am not a picky traveler. My family and I have simple tastes and don't require much. However, this hotel hits an all-time low, especially as many sites give it 3 stars. No way. The rooms are dirty and majorly outdated. Just walking around in my socks in the room turned my socks black. The shower had pubic hairs in it. There were no trash can liners. Fixtures and other things in the room were broken. I actually could handle all that. However, the walls must be paper thin because I could hear every footfall above us. Some idiots were drinking and partying down the hall from us all night. Finally, at midnight, I had to go out in the hall and ask them to be quiet (I have young kids). I should not have had to do that. They did not stop, so I called the front desk and no one responded. I don't think the noise stopped until 2:30 am. We were all exhausted and extremely unhappy. The breakfast is ridiculous. It's nasty. Plus, they let performers from theaters around Branson come hit you up for business while you're trying to eat. I found it very rude. Needless to a say, we stayed elsewhere for the rest of our trip. My husband spoke with someone at the front desk about our concerns and she just shrugged and said, "Sorry.". She looked like she'd heard all this before. I highly recommend you spend your money elsewhere. This hotel is the pits.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty....Old Decor....High Priced...Cheap Room Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Jmb2020
Reviews.Content: Booked a KING Jacuzzi Unit. Paid $100.... This hotel is very old...The color schemes reflect the 70's.....Mauves, Pinks & light blues.....All of the walls in the unit were painted PINK....The TV was the old box style. The picture on the TV was terrible, and there were only like 8 channels. They didn;t even have basic cable channels like TWC........ I had to clean the Jacuzzi before we could use it.....it had pubic hair in it....scum from the previous users...... The toilet paper was as cheap as it comes.......They didn't even provide hand soap, shampoo or conditioner...... The carpet was dirty....we didn't dare go barefoot in the unit..... The bed sheets had stains on them, the bed comforter was really dirty...... The breakfast was terrible...the eggs were microwaved....the sausage was like rubber..... DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY STAYING HERE!!! THERE ARE MUCH NICER HOTELS IN BRANSON FOR THIS KIND OF MONEY!! I even pointed out to the desk clerk that the Google Maps showed their hotel as being "Peremanently Closed" I didn't even get a simple "Thank you" from the hotel management. I pointed this out to them as I'm sure they have lost business due to this error on a major Map Quest Site..... Total waste of money.......

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in Branson!”
Reviews.Author: Doletta J
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Branson, it will not be our last! My family loved this hotel. The room was nice and clean, the free breakfast was really tasty, and the staff was very attentive! The location was great, we were close to everything! We will come back to Branson and we will stay at the Branson Towers again!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mike C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very pleased with our stay at Branson Towers Hotel. It was very clean, very comfortable and felt very safe. The free breakfast every morning was outstanding, but most of all, I loved the location, we were in an area of Branson with very little traffic, but you can be anywhere in Branson in just a few moments. And yes, every night is Ice Cream night, Yummm Yummm!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating hotel.”
Reviews.Author: nanberger721
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with a great breakfast. We arrived at 11 a.m. to check it out and were told that check in wasn't until 3 p.m. We didn't know where to go or what to do until then and the girl graciously gave us some ideas then went to ask her manager about the handicap accessible room we had requested and the manager said that there was one already available so we were able to check in early. So very happy about that as we were anxious to find out about the shows to reserve (which they can also help you with and with a discount!) and find out where to go for lunch. We were there for 3 days and every day was a pleasant experience. This hotel is away from the strip and the traffic there but easy enough to get to as they have the areas marked with yellow (least traffic, where this hotel is), blue and red (the worst traffic) so you finally get it figured out and are glad to be in the yellow!

Reviews.Title: “horriable..”
Reviews.Author: 777Jenny123
Reviews.Content: Front desk was not friendly. First night in the room there was no trash bags or coffee cups in the room. Called the front desk w/no answer. Left the room and asked housekeeping for directions to the vending machine and they sent us to the wrong floor.... Very noisy and had a bad smell- they said they had a water leak that needed to be fixed" Second night when house keeping was in our room we got the coffee cups however they did not put pillow cases on the pillow and no trash bags again. When I got ahold of the front desk they said we will send somebody up w/in 20 min. 1 1/2 hours later housekeeping only brought 1 trash bag and 1 pillow case and said "here you go" did not even offer to put them on the pillows or in the trash can or appoligize for the invonvience. Also they turned off our A.C. so when we got back from shopping our room was hot again. They also left a wet towel in the hot tub, did not empty the coffee pot from the previous day, and there was hair in the shower. When we left they did not ask how our stay was nor do i think they cares. another person was down there wanting trash bags too.. So I assume the hotel is trying to cut corners and save money and running on a skelton crue. will NEVER come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Kevin A
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed there twice already this year. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Service is great. I highly recommend staying there while in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Always great”
Reviews.Author: RK4003
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times and are never disappointed. The rooms are comfortable and clean, the staff is friendly, the pool is great, and the ice cream socials are a real treat!

Reviews.Title: “Branson Towers, June 2012”
Reviews.Author: Jay T
Reviews.Content: Branson Towers was a great place to stay! We booked it on line not knowing anything about the hotel or location and it turned out to be the best possible choice! We were 100% satisfied with our stay. What a beautiful, NICE CLEAN PLACE, quiet rooms, wonderful pool & hot tub, and great breakfast spread. I highly recommend this place to everyone. This will always be the only place I will stay, when in Branson!

Reviews.Title: “Our School's stay”
Reviews.Author: Stacy T
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be very clean, quiet, secure and friendly. The staff and management were courteous and helpful with all aspects of the stay. Breakfast was good. The ice cream social at night was a nice touch and also the entertainment (Voices of Glory) was fantastic. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: 1405Loved
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a 4 night 5 day stay at this hotel and it was delightful. Awesome staff, great food, clean rooms, beautiful atmosphere! Great nightly entertainment and dessert!

Reviews.Title: “Business Men, Don't Waste Your Time”
Reviews.Author: Kevin B
Reviews.Content: I had a contract with the management of the Branson Towers Hotel to have a Miracle Crusade Gospel meeting with a live Band for the Table Rock Room from 3 - 11pm. I was told that after 9pm we would have to keep the music down. I thought that was only fair. I got there at 1:00 and the woman at the desk told me the band was already setting up. It takes about 2-3 hrs to do that. They watched as the band members brought all the equipment in. At 3:30 the band started practicing. The manager burst into the room and yelled you [the band] has to go! We can't have this! We don't want any noise coming into the hallway.You have to leave now or I'm calling the police. Remember, we are a Christian group. FYI there is a grand piano in the waiting area that was being played so loud you have to listen to each other talk very carefully. We had to cancel our meeting and the band drove 2 hrs to get back home. After a long discussion they offered me a $50 refund. That was a clear insult to me. My wife was shaken up very badly and the bands hard work and long drive was for nothing. The contract all of a sudden didn't matter to them and they told me "too bad." On top of all that, the room was filthy. The carpet smells. The chairs are old, and the lighting is very poor and most of the fixtures are loose. The speaker system is a 1965 model with (1) microphone. The room we stayed in that night was the same way. The phone didn't work. The faucet in the sink leaked all over the counter top. The shower head let very little water out and it took 4-5 minutes to get hot water in the shower. The parking lot is not lit up at night and it is full of large pot holes. There is no room in front to park to pay for the room because they allow buses to be there and so cars have to compete with the buses. Last of which is the lack of carts to take your things up to your room.There are (3) for the whole Hotel. People were keeping them over night in their rooms so they would have the use of one the next morning. GO ANYWHERE BUT HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Hot Air and Hard Beds”
Reviews.Author: Christie C
Reviews.Content: The air was turned off when we arrived and it was 4pm and 90 degrees outside,but even on high the air never got cool even the by the next day.The next thing I noticed was the bathroom,there was hair on the sink,the floor,the bathtub,other people's hair everywhere,very nasty,that is just a no no.The Hotel is not very convenient,very out of the way also.The beds were also very hard and uncomfortable and you are given a tiny almost flat pillow.I will say the pool area was very clean and the hot breakfast was a good deal and always had plenty of food out.I wouldn't stay again,it wasn't a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “My new "Go To" hotel for Branson”
Reviews.Author: happygirlof5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Branson Towers with my daughter’s Girl Scout Troop when they went to Scout Days at Silver Dollar City. This hotel was very clean and comfortable. The rooms were not too small. They had a refrigerator which is nice. Since were traveling with young girls and there were two high schools staying there I was concerned about the noise level but everything was very quiet with no complaints about the noise our girls sometimes made. The only drawback about the room was that it took a while for the water to get hot in the shower. As long as you know to run it for a while before you get in it is ok. The pool was nice but you should know that you have to walk outside to get to it. This was fine for a warm May weekend but I don’t think I would like it if we were in Branson during the winter. It is a very short walk though. I estimate it to be about 20 feet. They did have bathrooms in the building with the pool so you could easily change before making the dash back to your room if it is cold. The breakfast was good as can be expected for the money. There were two people working the breakfast bar and they did an excellent job of keeping everything well stocked. There were 3 waffle makers so the line was short to make a waffle. In the evening they had piano music with ice cream and cobbler for sale at $1.25. It really adds a nice touch. Since our primary objective of this trip was Silver Dollar City I liked the fact that it was a short distance from the park and on a route that avoided the crazy Branson traffic. It was about a 10-15 minute travel time. I would have to say that for the money of this hotel it was a very good deal and when I need hotel in Branson again this will be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “R&R”
Reviews.Author: Marie W
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Branson Towers Hotel, but certainly not our last! We will be returning guest. From the first contact after reviewing their website to our final day of checking out to return home~~was very pleasant. The staff was very knowledgeable and helpful securing us a comfortable room that they included (at no extra charge) a recliner chair for my husband comfort as he has COPD and must rest with oxygen/C-pap at intervals. The room itself was very comfortable and close to exterior doors in the hallways so there was very little extra walking to our car. I believe this is the most cleant hotel from the very front driveway, thru the guest areas, breakfast nook and most importantly, our room, that we have experienced d in Branson,,,and we have had nice rooms in other hotels/motels in our 40+years of visiting Branson. The guest breakfast was very enjoyable and offered something for everyone's taste. Good Job! Yes, we are sharing our satisfaction with Branson Towers with all our friends and hopefully they will try one off the Great Hiwway 76, too ! In closing,,,just a fyii: The only thing we didn't do that I would encourage guests that have Season Paseses at Silver Dollar City is to MENTION this at check in (or even on phone if phone reservation) as that would have saved us another $30. We did not know this fact until we were going thru our SDC travel pack for the next days and found Branson Towers listed among the lodgings that SDC honored discounts. However, the responsibility is on the consumer here,~~Hubby did mention at checkout that had we done 'our homework', we would have asked for the SDC discount, too. He said the clerk gave him a big grin...all's good!. See you next time. Garry and Marie West / Oklahoma

Reviews.Title: “Family get away”
Reviews.Author: KenSanders1
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Branson and Branson Towers will be our hotel of choice if we ever get to return. Our room was next to the rear exit and we thought we would hear everyting and everyone coming and going... thankfully it was not the case. Beds were comfortable, rooms were large and the everything was very clean. Although the breakfast was good... the waffle batter was to thin, the fruit mix to sour (saw lots of it trashed) and the coffee bar should be in the dining area NOT out in the hall! The desk staff was very helpful and quick to respond to our requests and needs.

Reviews.Title: “Our third stay at Branson Towers Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susan H
Reviews.Content: We usually enjoy our stay at Branson Towers Hotel. Our room was clean, the bed was very comfortable and the jacuzzi in our room was nice after a long day of shopping. The furniture is a little out-dated and a flat-screen television would have been nice. We stayed two nights, the breakfast was delicious the first morning, but there wasn't much food left by 9 a.m. the second morning. The breakfast area was overwhelmed with high school marching band students and apparently they consumed most of the breakfast food. We ended up eating at a Shoney's on our way home.. We had difficultly sleeping the first night due to the loudness of the high school students slamming doors, running up and down the hallways and girls screaming. The second night we turned on the jacuzzi ventilation fan, just to drown out the noise from the hallway. We appreciate the fact that Branson Towers is a non-smoking facility, which is a MAJOR plus for us!!!! The ice cream and cobbler was a wonderful treat each night when we got back from seeing a show. We would probably stay there again in the future, however we prefer a bed & breakfast because it's quieter.

Reviews.Title: “stayed 4-13 12 to 4-15-12”
Reviews.Author: tla005
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff-they really helped me - I needed a recliner to sleep as I am disabled & I was staying with a big group of school kids on this trip and they were so understanding &* accomadating!! I loved talking to the security guard-our kiddos got great compliments on their behaviors!! Great breakfast bar too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice folks to stay with.”
Reviews.Author: julesbadge
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Branson Towers on our very first trip to Branson, last week. The staff was very friendly and accommodating-thank you, Jonathan. The pool was very clean and kept at a nice temp. Our bed was just great (pillow top-firm), pillows were good, as well. Fridge and microwave in the room (bonus!). While these rooms aren't fancy, by any means, they are clean and comfortable, and a good value, we thought. It was also quiet. Didn't hear any traffic during the night. It takes about 15-20 minutes to get to the golf courses from the hotel. When we make it back to Branson, we'll stay here again, AND they'll give you a discount when we come back! We had a great time. Thanks ya'll! Julie B, Ravenna MI

Reviews.Title: “Branson's Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: mmwoodle
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel to stay at when I come to Branson. It's in a great location, quiet and easily accessible to everything in Branson without the bumper to bumper traffic. The rooms are gorgeous (we stay in the preferred rooms---newly updated with a mini fridge, microwave, iron/ironing board, and hair dryer in each room---oh don't let me forget the pillow top mattresses are heavenly after a long day of shopping and sightseeing). They have a nice indoor pool and spa (and I love that there are always lots of towels at poolside for your convienence). They offer a free hot breakfast each morning and also an ice cream social (all items $2.50 or less) along with a piano player. The staff are warm and inviting. If you haven't noticed, I highly recommend the Branson Tower's. Plus, an added incentive is that if you are a returning guest you get a discount!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice out of the way place!”
Reviews.Author: Gerald C
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very nice one. The continental breakfast was excellent. The rooms were very clean. The pool water was cool (but not cold) and refreshing. The ice cream social at a minimal charge, along with the piano player was very neat. My only complaint was the wake up call. The first morning we asked for a 7:00 a.m. wake up call and didn't get it until 7:10. The next morning we woke up for a wake up call (I don't remember the time) and were woken up about 7 minutes early. Otherwize...it was a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Branson Weekend with Friends”
Reviews.Author: momofasailor
Reviews.Content: We had a great time and wonderful stay! Room was Clean, Staff Friendly, and Hotel location was Good for getting around the Mall's and Landing. We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “December in Branson”
Reviews.Author: msh60
Reviews.Content: We have been traveling to Branson for many years, but this was the first time we had stayed at Branson Towers. We were very impressed, the public areas of the hotel, and our room itself was very clean. The ice cream social at 10:00 pm every night was great (I don't want to mislead anyone, there is a charge for ice cream, but it is minimal. You could also get homemade cobbler with your ice cream...I had a huge piece of cobbler and a large scoop of ice cream for $2). Breakfast was good as well. We had a room with a jacuzzi, the jacuzzi was sparkling clean. All in all, we would be happy to stay here again. There is an pool, which we did not go look at. The pool is indoors, but in its own building in the courtyard. To access it, you need to walk outside for a few yards. Since we stayed there in December, I didn't go check it out. [Before I wrote my own review, I read some of the others. It is true that the room was not decorated in the most modern style, so if that is important to you, this may not be the hotel for you. The only "problem" we experienced is that on our first morning there, we had to wait a bit for breakfast foods to be replenished. Everyone was working hard, there were just that many guests, the room was packed.]

Reviews.Title: “Branson Towers Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: beachladyMissouri
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my 2 nights. Even though it was the off-season, the hotel was clean; had everything I needed; breakfast both mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 2.5 Star Property”
Reviews.Author: liketotravel167
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of others on this website, we decided to stay here on our recent trip to Branson. The reviewers who said this was one of the nicest places they've stayed either have never been anywhere, or they work for the hotel. This was advertised as a 2 1/2 star hotel, I wouldn't give it more than one. Our room was out-of-date, there were dead bugs on the wall of the bathroom, and there was no shampoo in the room (one small bar of soap and an empty body was dispenser in the shower). The hotel states on their website that the breakfast includes the following items--biscuits and gravy, pastries, fresh fruit and assorted breads & bagels (there were four or fives slices of bread and three dried out bagel halves), non of these were present. I had to go to the front desk to ask if they were going to replenish what they did have out. Needless to say I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: ThreeHeartsFarm
Reviews.Content: Lovely, sparkling clean hotel, off the beaten track in Branson yet just a stones throw from the Sight & Sound theater. Very comfortable beds as well as a hearty & delicious breakfast. My only suggestion to the hotel would be choose a more neutral paint color for the rooms, as the pinkish hue reminded me weirdly of a funeral parlor for some reason...otherwise you will be pleasantly surprised at the value you get for the reasonable cost. We stayed as a family of four and our breakfast alone was worth the room fee. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “The best breakfast buffet ever!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: todavis
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several 4 star hotels in Chicago. This beat them all! Starting with the check-in process- very welcoming and friendly Rooms- very large and the beds were really comfortable, they do need to update the televisions to flat screens Bathroom- it was as clean as I've ever been in. At 10pm in the evening, they offer floats, cobbler, ice cream for a small fee in the lobby. Cobbler and ice cream was $2.50 for the two combined. The cobbler was made fresh and you could smell it throughout the hotel. They even had a player piano playing Christmas carols. The hallways need to be repainted. They were showing a lot of wear and tear. That's about the only negative. They do need need to offer a sharps container for medical purposes. I need 3 pages to compliment the the breakfast buffet. I don't know how they offer this for no charge. Waffes, donuts, cereal, toast, bagels, fruit, sausage patties, biscuits and gravy and scrambled eggs. I'm sure I left some things off this list. Things that were suppose to be hot were hot and things that are suppose to be cold were cold. The breakfast area could seat at least 100 guest. The breakfast staff was doing an awesome job keeping the food stocked. There were close to 65 eating at the time ate. They do need a few more salt and pepper shakers. If you don't like the words "MERRY CHRISTMAS," do not go to Branson during the Christmas holidays. If actually offends me when those words aren't use during the season. Everyone says Merry Christmas at all the businesses. I can't wait to stay here again on my next excursion to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Wilmoth family Holiday a great time together at your hotel.”
Reviews.Author: E Joe W
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the pleasant and clean facility including one of the finest of breakfast provided by hotels and motels. A special joy to our family was the Hospitality room which we rented for the gatherings of our entire family ages 1 month to 84 years of age. It went so well that I am very hopeful that we will be able to return there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Julie g
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Branson Towers for several years and always enjoy the pleasant staff, clean facilities, great pool/hot tub area and overall beauty of the hotel. We have gone for a romantic getaway or a family vacation. Always been great!

Reviews.Title: “What A Christmas Suprise!”
Reviews.Author: 1405Loved
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from Spending 5 days in Branson, staying at The Branson Towers. It was a "beautiful experience". The hotel was decorated in an elegante manner and the holiday spirit was certainly felt there. The Hotel Staff were so cheerful and provided a comfortable "home" away from home to each of us. In addition to the delicious breakfast each morning, they serve a fun cobbler event in the evening, with your choice of cobblers, with ice cream, rootbeer floats, or just plain ice cream. While enjoying your 10 pm dessert, you are entertained by a local Pianist, who teaches music at the College of The Ozarks! We had a terrifc vacation and one I would recommend to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: CTZS
Reviews.Content: On this trip to Branson we found our home away from home. No doubt will stay here again! Great Place, Great Price, Great Location, Great Suite!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, pretty hotel. Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Jim S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is affordable and super duper clean. The staff is very helpful, the pool is nice and the breakfast is yummy. The ice cream social was nice too. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Bus Tour”
Reviews.Author: marlene701
Reviews.Content: My sisters, Mary, Ruth and I always stay here and I was pleased when the bus tour I recently went on was booked here. The rooms are so easy to get to and they are nice. Love the lobby and the piano playing and the ice cream and cobbler. Marlene Petersen

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but don't book a suite”
Reviews.Author: 67cougarcar
Reviews.Content: I want to start by saying the Branson Towers is our hotel of choice when staying in Branson. We've stayed in several different hotels and have found this to be the nicest for the money - we've stayed here several times and will definitely stay at the Branson Towers on our next visit. It is a nice hotel in a great location with a breakfast included that can't be beat anywhere - not even even at a Holiday Inn Express. With that said, I must say we were disappointed in our suite during our recent visit in late Oct. 2011. We stayed here in June 2011 and enjoyed a nicely updated double Queen room. When we came back this Fall we were looking for something a little more romantic so we booked a king suite with a fireplace. When entering the suite, I was disappointed to see it had not yet been updated. I was very surprised, considering it was a suite and costs more than a regular room. Following I will list the pros and cons of booking a suite so you can make your own decision: PROS: Very large and spacious suite, a nice whirlpool tub for two and a very comfortable bed and pillows (mattresses and pillows have been upgraded so we did enjoy a great nights sleep!). There is a full or queen size sleeper sofa in the large living room, as well as a table for 4, small refrigerator and sink. This suite would be perfect for a family of 4 or even larger as it would easily accommodate a roll-away bed. CONS: Furniture not updated, as it was in the double queen room we booked this past June and there were a couple of stains on the carpet that needed cleaning. Also, the fireplace did not work to our satisfaction - in fact, the flame was not visible while sitting on the sofa. I had to sit on the hearth to be able to see the flame. The fireplace was my single reason for renting this suite (not the tub, as we prefer showers) over a regular room so obviously I felt we wasted our money. With all this said, I think the suite would be perfect for families and if you're into a nice soak in a whirlpool tub then I would book this room. However, if your plans are to cuddle up in front of the fireplace - forget it and book a regular, nicely updated room

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: GFTraveler81
Reviews.Content: Made a last minute trip to Branson over the weekend following Veteran's Day. Needed a hotel with an indoor pool. Branson hotels were pretty booked up. Chose this hotel and was apprehensive. I was pleasantly surprised. It is a little older but seems pretty well maintained. Very spacious lobby. Pool area is older but a good size and adequate. Hotel is located on the top of a hill which makes for a nice view. Pretty standard hotel free breakfast. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Motor-coach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PjtoursNashvilleTn
Reviews.Content: My group stayed at the Branson Towers hotel in Aug of this year. This was my first time for P J Tours, but the start of many future visits to this Property. The rooms were very spacious, and clean. The staff very very helpful. I treated my group to the Ice cream social one night and it was a great way to finish off a busy day in Branson!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't forget your shampoo”
Reviews.Author: Auntjam
Reviews.Content: On first impression this is a great 2.5 star place to stay. Nice approach, pretty lobby. Rooms are decent size and beds comfortable. But this is the first hotel ever, whatever the star rating that didn't offer toiletries. There was a liquid soap dispenser over the tub. Thats all in the form of toiletries! And only one washcloth. Guess they thought we could share that. I asked for a bar soap and shampoo. Got 1 small soap bar but no shampoo. But did get two washcloths this time. There was coffee in the room first morning, but the next morning I discovered that there was no coffee and they even left us our dirty styrofoam cups for us to reuse. I went to the front desk to ask for coffee, clean cups and shampoo. Was told they would get us the coffee and cups but no shampoo. Didn't even get the coffee and cups till I called that night and requested again!

Reviews.Title: “Wrong Date”
Reviews.Author: April M
Reviews.Content: Tried to stay at this hotel last weekend. But when we arrived it was booked for the weekend before. Asked for a refund and a room. Was told no, its been over 7 days and we have no rooms. Yes its been over 7days cause it was booked for the wrong date. We knew when the vacation was to be. There were no rooms on the correct date we arrived, This was booked over the phone and we should have gone a different route apparently. Asked for the upper managment info and we were told they didnt have this at the time. Sent an email to them and its been 48 hours later and nothing in return. Not an even "we are working on the problem to see what happend."

Reviews.Title: “Dependably Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: Don D
Reviews.Content: Easy to find. Close to our show. Friendly staff. We slept well. Enjoyed breakfast choice & speed in spacious sunny room. Look forward to staying with you again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathy P
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very clean hotel. It is on a hill overlooking Branson and close to the Mansion where our show was located. It is also close to the Sight and Sound theater where we had previously seen a show. My mother recommended this hotel to us as this is where she stays when she comes to Branson to see the shows. We appreciated the full breakfast we received the next morning. The people who work here were friendly. The beds were comfortable. An indoor is provided, too.

Reviews.Title: “clean, good value”
Reviews.Author: minijetset
Reviews.Content: the pool was great for the kids, it was a little outdated but very clean. it was a perfect location, close to everything but out of the busy area. continental breakfast was fantastic, included waffles, biscuits and gravy, eggs, cereal, donuts, oatmeal, fruit, etc. beds were very comfortable, nice new showers.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel we stayed at on Vacation.”
Reviews.Author: cmsnobuff
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and very comfortable. The breakfast was good. Easy to find and easy to get to different places in the Branson area. Beautiful lobby, and the peach cobbler in the evening is an added bonus. All of the hotel staff were friendly and efficient. This is definitely our hotel in Branson next time we come. Loved the shows in Branson. Joseph Hall as Elvis is a must see, and so is Tom Mullica's Red Skelton Tribute. So much to see and do, needed more time in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Lodging”
Reviews.Author: marcia2465
Reviews.Content: This is a nice budget hotel. Staff is friendly, rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. They do still have the old fashion 21 inch screen T.Vs and don't offer any shampoo and only those tiny bars of shop. The continental breakfast is better than most. There were three tour busses full of guests when we were there so breakfast room was full from 6:30 on. Location is good and out of the traffic on Hwy 76,

Reviews.Title: “What a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mykiacat
Reviews.Content: I have been to Branson many times, and I highly recommend Branson Towers. First off it's in a good location off the main strip, and easy to get to other attractions. It's a beautiful place looks like a colonial type building with the tall pillars outside. And inside they have 3 beautiful staircases, along with elevators to all 3 levels. The price was fantastic, and it was so clean, I couldn't believe how clean it was. Their beds are to die for, all have pillow top mattresses & I'm one that always has to take her own pillow, well I forgot mine, and was really upset, as I just knew I wasn't going to sleep well. Well forget that problem, their pillows were just fine & I was very much surprised I slept thru the night. They are different in that after the late shows let out from 10 to 11 p.m. the hotel has Blueberry and Peach Cobbler & Ice cream that you can purchase, it's only $2.50 to get the cobbler & ice cream together, and the Blackberry was very good. They also serve a wonderful breakfast in the morning, ceral, fruit, donuts, biscuits & gravy...yum, sausage patties, eggs, make your own waffel, juice, coffee, you name it & they have it. Service was great. I personally can't think of a nicer place to stay & if you sign up on line before you make your reservations they give you a discount, but I can't remember what the % was. They do have different levels of rooms, so ours didn't have a refrigerator or microwave but we didn't need it. If you have a family it also a great place. I forgot to mention the swimming pool is in a seperate enclosed house. So if you are going to Branson please give it a try. I will definitely book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice - CLEAN and COMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: AZ2MI2AZ
Reviews.Content: My mother and I decided to take a quick last minute trip for the evening to Branson. I checked out Trip Advisor and read the many nice reviews that mentioned the clean rooms, comfortable beds, nice breakfast and my favorite the ice cream / cobbler social every evening between 10:00 - 11:00pm. This is perfect as it starts after the shows let out. The ice cream and cobbler were quite tasty. The Branson Towers were just as others have written; we were not disappointed and non-smoking. One of the cleanest hotels I have ever stayed at and for such a reasonable price. Nice enclosed pool / hot tub with a large outdoor courtyard area outside for groups or families to play cards or enjoy the outdoor weather. Large, clean, nicely furnished / decorated rooms with nice pillow top mattresses. The breakfast was perfect and the dining room large with plenty of natural light and great food. We were able to order our discounted show tickets on the phone and they delivered them to the front desk. Can't ask for anymore convenience than that. The Branson Towers will be my go to hotel for my next visit and would recommend them to anyone who inquires.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was very nice”
Reviews.Author: James R
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful inside and out with a nice grand staircase and player grand piano in the lobby. The room along with the hotel was very clean and the bed was very comfortable We had a very good breakfast each morning. Lots of fresh hot food. There were eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravy, 4 Belgian waffle makers. There is fruit, and hot or cold cereals as well as donuts. Fresh coffee was available 24 hours. We used the indoor hot tub and pool right after checking in to relax after the long drive. It was great! They also had a ice cream social each night at 10pm which was neat. When we go back to Branson we will stay again at the Branson Towers Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Super clean and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Felandforrest
Reviews.Content: Had a mini fridge and a microwave, breakfast was pretty good. Indoor heated pool. Slightly outdated decor but the plush pillow top mattresses made up for it ! :) will definitely be stain there next time I'm in Branson ! Away from main strip,only a 6 minute drive from hwy 76

Reviews.Title: “will never be back (sorry)”
Reviews.Author: stoverEarleArkansas
Reviews.Content: Checked in and room air conditioner was off, and it was 100 degrees outside,. Called maitenence man he came and said air conditioner was bad, and that they had ordered 23 new air conditioners,. I wonder why they are renting the rooms with the bad air conditioners. Was planning to stay three days there at the hotel, but only stayed one. The staff would not help me with the problem, and i think they just didnt care!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Ray B
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Branson Towers numerous times because we can count on a c l e a n updated room, hallways neat and orderly...... Beds are comfy...breakfast is great....you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “We've stayed here before and will continue doing so.”
Reviews.Author: jeremytkay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here once before for my brother's wedding. The hotel is extremely easy to get to and it's not on the main strip. We had two queen beds in our room. We had a non-smoking room and there were absolutely no odors you might get in a budget minded hotel. The breakfast was hot and plentiful. What we thought was really neat is they have an ice cream social every night at 10pm. It's not free, but it covers that late evening sweet tooth you might have offering ice cream, root beer floats, and different cobblers. We definitely will be staying there again, and again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad find off the beaten path.”
Reviews.Author: Bill W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little off the beaten path but was not too bad. We just stayed one night (we stayed at 2 other hotels during the week both of which cost more per night) but this hotel was fairly nice. The staff was great and the breakfast was a pleasant surprise. Ice cream social at 10pm drew a crowd and was reasonably priced - ice cream/cobbler. The pool was rocking pretty late that night, and the hot tub was overflowing. The pool area is enclosed so it was loud with all of the kids - not a complaint just an observation. Older hotel and the rooms are typical of this price range but this was the only room of the 3 we stayed in with an in room min fridge. All things considered I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the stay!”
Reviews.Author: NJONES2010
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I went to Silver Dollar City. During our visit we stayed at Branson Towers Hotel. While there we were treated very nice by staff, our room was very clean, breakfast was great and located not far from places that we wanted visit. Great place to stay for the money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jared R
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Branson Towers. The staff there were very friendly and the continental breakfast was better than most. The ice cream social at night was a unique touch.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: newman71667
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say this was one of the best hotel experiances i have ever had. the room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. i loved the courtyard with the huge pool house. the hotel was very quite and the staff was extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “"We loved it and we'll be back!")”
Reviews.Author: sunnieclover
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our visit to Branson. Branson Towers is one of our favorite hotels, the staff was very nice and considerate. They seem to go beyond the call of duty. The breakfast was excellent. We loved the ice cream social's. Thank you. We would highly recommend it to anyone traveling to Branson wheather business or pleasure. Until next time. Thanks again

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room, pool and breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Ernie-Sharlene R
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. It is a good value and the rooms are clean and the pool was excellent. Off the strip so traffic wasn't as bad as it could be. If you are going to the Mansion Theater it's in an even better location for you. We were there for a concert and ate at what is now Sharkey's and it was fun. We moved to the Branson area because we love it here. GREAT hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: laniet38
Reviews.Content: We chose this motel because of its location and past reviews - I'd agree with the reviews - you get a clean room, good breakfast, and very reasonable price - basically all we needed for one night's stay. The decor was outdated - yes - and improvements could be made there, but I choose cleanliness over decor any day.

Reviews.Title: “I plan on staying here my next trip”
Reviews.Author: MaryMaryQuiteContrar
Reviews.Content: The accommodations were great and I will certainly stay here the next time we come back to Branson. My granddaughters really loved the ice cream social they had at night and every thing else - computer room, pool, breakfast. We did not use the Spa or Fitness Center so I couldn't comment on them but I am sure they were as good as the rest of the hotel accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Trip”
Reviews.Author: shello_11
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved staying at the hotel. The room was very clean and cozy. The bed and the pillows were very comfortable. The only negative was the pool smelled pretty bad. Also,if you get a room on the 2nd floor be aware of the noise on the 3rd floor.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay again and again.”
Reviews.Author: Sal4317
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Branson Towers. We were pleasantly surprisd with the accomodations. The room was very clean and had a fridge and small coffee pot. We all enjoyed the great breakfast! The staff was exceptional!! Thanks to all of you!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It and We Will Be Back!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1405Loved
Reviews.Content: If you want a real treat...The Branson Tower Hotel is it!! It is a beautiful place to stay. You walk into a gorgeous foyer, tastefully decorated with a beautiful Baby Grand Piano, and very comfortable furniture to fit everyone's needs! The interior as well as the exterior is very well kept. Some one of the staff is always making sure everything is in order! The "entire staff".... including the manager, front desk, dining room, maintenance, and housekeeping employees are wonderful! We will continue to make "The Branson Hotel", our home away from home when we visit Branson 4 times a year! Come try it you will like it.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised that we didn't like this place!”
Reviews.Author: chas77777
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival checked in at the main desk. Just didn't like the gentleman waiting on us. He seemed to be wanting to do something else. We roomed in the 150's on the first floor. From these rooms its about a 80 to 100 yard walk to breakfast and ice if you wanted any. All the soda machines were empty of most product. The toilets needed to be flushed at least 2 or more times after each use. We experienced a power outage in our area of the hotel for about 2 hours. (Thank god the A/C's still worked during this time.) We did sleep well and the beds were OK. Sorry but we will not stay there again as will no one else in our group of parents and grandparents there for softball games. Thats about 6 to 8 familes.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds, great breakfast & great location!”
Reviews.Author: 67cougarcar
Reviews.Content: Book this hotel! The Branson Towers Hotel offered a good value for our money on nice accommodations with an excellent breakfast included in the price. We booked an updated room, which had one of the most comfortable beds (and pillows) we have ever slept on in a hotel (in any price range). We were traveling with a baby and they allowed us to bring our porta-crib and set up in the room but I believe they will provide one for an additional fee. We also had a mini-fridge in our room, which was convenient for storing milk and soft drinks. In addition to all the usual pastires and cereal fare, the breakfast included a good assortment of hot items, including biscuits, gravy, sausage, eggs and waffles. We were able to have a big, hearty breakfast before heading out each day - so good and so convenient! The staff was friendly and helpful - we needed extra pillows and someone brought them to our room within 15 minutes of calling the front desk. Besides the comfy beds and excellent breakfast, what I really like about the hotel is the location. We much prefer a quieter location away from the noise of the 76 strip. There was absolutely no traffic noise at all. Yet, it was close enough that you could be at any restaurants, shows or shopping along the Shepherd of the Hills Highway in about 5 minutes. If you're into hustle & bustle and lots of traffic, stay on the strip, but if bumper to bumper traffice gets on your nerves then this is the hotel for you. The only negative was it did not appear the carpet in the hallways had been updated and there were a couple of stains in places (not too bad). Our room appeared to have fairly new carpeting and everything was nice and clean, as was the Gazebo room where breakfast was served. This is not a 5 star hotel but I give it an Excellent rating because it's one of the nicest hotels we've stayed in at this price point. We will stay at the Branson Towers on our next trip and will recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot to go”
Reviews.Author: onebadragon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a co-worker. And she was right. Great night sleep, EASY to get to and wonderful location to get around Branson. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We are looking forward to our next stay and will be bringing the grandkids as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: sjjaco
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the friendly staff, the breakfast and most of all the great cobbler and ice cream at night.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel i have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: tootall1022
Reviews.Content: Branson Towers was the nicest and cleanest hotel i have ever seen and been to. The staff was very polite, our rooms were kept clean, and if we had an issue the employees took care of it. I had left some items in Branson and an employee named Becky had kept me informed on what was going on. She had made sure to call to make sure we got the package and she was very polite. I will totally recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “A good night of sleep at a good price!”
Reviews.Author: Arkiegirl1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 12 years ago and was afraid it would not be kept up by now, but we were surprised. It is still a great place to stay. We had a recently renovated room and it was unusually clean for a hotel room. The only negative we found was the mattress was old and not as supportive as we like. Our 19 year old son and my parents were with us. My parents were very satisfied with their room also. The price was very reasonable. The breakfast was waffles, toast, doughnuts,biscuits, gravy, sausage, eggs, and cereal. Everything we tried was tasty. It is off the beaten path, but still close to everything. We went to Sight and Sound Theater which was close by. A good night's sleep for a good price. We recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: bjjohnsonne
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. One of the best places we have ever stayed. nice upkept rooms. really good hot breakfast, great indoor pool. free ice cream in the evening The staff was extremely helpful and nice. We payed a great price for a hotel that we would have payed twice as much for anywhere else. I would recommnend this one to anyone traveling to Branson. We also liked the fact that it was not on the main street through town.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break Stay”
Reviews.Author: ubenumber2
Reviews.Content: We went to Branson for spring break for a few days and stayed at this hotel. We had no complaints at all. The rooms were clean and large. The pool area was clean and the kids loved it. The breakfast bar was far better than Ive had at 100 dollar a night hotels , had gravy biscuits, sausage , boiled eggs , bagels , make your own waffles , fruit , cereal, toast and other items. There was a couple bus loads of teenage to college age kids staying and we heard no noise from them in our room at all , the front desk was very helpfull , all in all we will stay here again , best 55 dollar a night room we have ever stayed in , and if you go to their website and sign up for their webdeal you can get 5 bucks off a night , even better

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience, hair on sheets, would never stay again!!!”
Reviews.Author: familyvacations2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Branson Towers about 5 years ago and I thought it was nice so we tried it again. We reserved a 2 room suite. The fireplace was broken and the sofa bed was broken. I always check the beds at any hotel for bed begs. Upon removing the sheets to inspect I noticed the mattress cover had several hairs all over the cover. Then I found hairs on the sheets and blanket. The front desk brought new sheets and the same thing, so he brought another set of sheets, after the third set of sheets they again had hairs and they ran out of fitted sheets and clean blankets. Mind you there were not busy at all. In addition, the recliner was ripped and broken. The interior of the room had several spots where their was damage and had white spackle on it (the walls were pink). When you stay in a room in Branson that is $100+ you expect a better quality room. The staff apologized and gave me $10 off but that did not make up for the horrible experience. The hotel needs major renovations in the rooms and hire new maid service!!

Reviews.Title: “R.V Breakdown”
Reviews.Author: Ebourdeau5
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean well kept up. Personel were very polite and helpful extending every courtesy they could possibly do.

Reviews.Title: “Our best stay in Branson yet”
Reviews.Author: kcoggins56
Reviews.Content: Very elegant, yet down to earth, friendly atmosphere. LOVE the beautifully decorated lobby that greeted us each time we returned from our days adventures. The front desk staff were very helpful and gracious in meeting our needs. Location was perfect.. Close enough to attractions and shows, yet away from the main traffic at showtimes. Look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I was looking for in a Hotel at an affordable price!”
Reviews.Author: Karen6864
Reviews.Content: This hotel was off the main tourist strip,located on a hill that overlooked the lights of Branson. It was quiet yet close to everything we wanted to see. The "player grand piano" in the lobby was a nice touch. We were able to stay in a King bed/Jacuzzi room for less than $100 a night. The staff was nice and very helpful. They gave us a map of the town that contained many coupons for local restaurants and entertainment discounts. We will definitely stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Branson Towers Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 236 Shepherd of the Hills Expressway, Branson, MO 65616
